allow:
Bash(changes detected" for highlighted functions.

Root cause: _symbols_differ\(\) was comparing line_number, which changes
whenever code is added/removed above the function, even if the function
itself is unchanged.

Example:
- calculate_roic_wacc_spread was at line 2870 in HEAD~1
- Code added above it, moved to line 3105 in HEAD  
- Implementation identical, but marked as "modified" ‚ùå

Solution: Removed line_number comparison from _symbols_differ\(\).
Now only compares meaningful changes:
- Metadata \(parameters, return type, etc.\)
- Resolved calls \(what the function calls\)  
- Documentation \(docstrings\)

This eliminates false positives from line number shifts. Functions are
only marked as changed if their implementation actually differs.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(1 <<'EOF'
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, '/Users/barlarom/PycharmProjects/Main/FlowDiff/src'\)
from analyzer.git.diff_analyzer import GitDiffAnalyzer
from pathlib import Path

analyzer = GitDiffAnalyzer\(Path\('.'\)\)
result = analyzer.analyze_diff\("HEAD~1", "HEAD"\)
print\(f"\\nTotal functions modified: {result.functions_modified}"\)
EOF)
